member.name: IMultiQI.QueryMultipleInterfaces

summary.para: Retrieves pointers to multiple supported interfaces on an object.

Calling this method is equivalent to issuing a series of separate calls except that you do not incur the overhead of a corresponding number of RPC calls. In multithreaded applications and distributed environments, keeping RPC calls to a minimum is essential for optimal performance.

member.param: The number of elements in the pMQIs array.
An array of structures. For more information, see Remarks.

returns.para: This method can return the following values.

listheader.description: The method retrieved pointers to all requested interfaces.
The method retrieved pointers to some, but not all, of the requested interfaces.
The method retrieved pointers to none of the requested interfaces.

member.name: IMultiQI
member.summary: Enables a client to query an object proxy, or handler, for multiple interfaces by using a single RPC call. By using this interface, instead of relying on separate calls to , clients can reduce the number of RPC calls that have to cross thread, process, or machine boundaries and, therefore, the amount of time required to obtain the requested interface pointers.
